abstract: A 16-year-old's efforts to share his thoughts aloud in a college class bring into sharp relief the tenuous balance between an individual's needs and the good of a group.
snippet: A 16-year-old's efforts to share his thoughts aloud in a college class bring into sharp relief the tenuous balance between an individual's needs and the good of a group.
lead_paragraph: I hope readers of The Choice will take a moment today to read my colleague Richard Perez-Pena's nuanced account of Phillip Garber Jr.'s efforts to get his professor at County College of Morris in New Jersey to call on him in class.

headline.main: Hand Raised High, a Stutterer Struggles to be Heard in Class
